benchmark_details.name: StackEval: Benchmarking LLMs in Coding Assistance
benchmark_details.overview: We present two comprehensive benchmarks to evaluate the performance of language models in coding assistance tasks, covering code writing, debugging, code review, and conceptual understanding.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of language models in coding assistance tasks across a variety of programming languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmarks primarily reflect current coding practices and might not fully capture LLM capabilities across all programming paradigms.

data.source: Stack Overflow questions and answers derived from public dumps.
data.size: 925 questions for StackEval, dynamic updates for StackUnseen.
data.annotation: Curated and verified through human annotation and AI assistance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on a rubric assessing accuracy, completeness, and relevance.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect how well LLMs satisfy user queries, focusing on practical application.
methodology.validation: Validated through expert review of generated answers.
